title: Battle of Hastings
prompt: A highly detailed, photo-realistic image of the Battle of Hastings as it might have appeared in 1066. No gunpowder weapons, no modern flags. The landscape shows open countryside under an overcast sky. Authentic 11th-century military detail and natural terrain. Depicts Norman cavalry with kite shields and chainmail attacking uphill against a dense Anglo-Saxon shield wall. The battlefield is an open slope near a wooden palisade. No castles or fantasy elements. Clearly 11th-century. No text or modern artifacts. Realistic proportions, cinematic style. Framed in landscape orientation. Composition balanced for horizontal display.

title: Battle of Verdun
visuals: clouds of smoke under overcast sky
prompt: A highly detailed, photo-realistic image of the Battle of Verdun as it might have appeared in 1916. The scene includes exhausted French soldiers in “bleu horizon” uniforms entrenched in mud-soaked foxholes near the ruins of Fort Douaumont, with twisted barbed wire in the foreground and cratered terrain stretching into the smoky distance. Massive artillery shells explode across a scorched landscape beneath a grey, overcast sky. Narrow-gauge supply tracks and makeshift shelters hint at the prolonged nature of the battle. The devastation is immense, with burned trees and collapsed stonework scattered across the Meuse sector. Authentic early 20th-century French military detail. No modern artifacts or text. Realistic proportions, cinematic style. Framed in landscape orientation. Composition balanced for horizontal display.

title: Charlotte Perriand & Le Corbusier Design Iconic Furniture
visuals: Charlotte Perriand assembling tubular steel frame
Le Corbusier reviewing sketches with a pipe in hand

prompt: A highly detailed, photo-realistic image of Charlotte Perriand collaborating with Le Corbusier in a Paris studio in 1929, designing iconic modernist furniture. The scene includes Charlotte Perriand in workwear, adjusting a tubular steel frame beside the LC4 Chaise Longue, while Le Corbusier reviews design sketches with a pipe in hand. Their atelier is minimalist, filled with mid-century modern design tools, leather upholstery, and metalworking equipment. Sunlight streams through tall industrial windows. Authentic 1920s clothing, furniture, and atmosphere. No modern artifacts. Cinematic proportions and realistic style. Framed in landscape orientation. Composition balanced for horizontal display.
